title: Calories in a T-Bone Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in a tbone steak, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
assumptions: Grilled, choice grade, approx. 300g cooked weight (about 10-12 oz edible portion), lean and fat trimmed to 1/8 inch, bone-in.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut size, grade, cooking method, trimming, and doneness. Check labels or use a nutrition app for precision.

quick_answer.text: A typical T-bone steak provides ~849 kcal and ~75 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a typical T-bone steak?
faqs.a: About 849 kcal for a 300g cooked T-bone steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a T-bone steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 75 g protein per 300g cooked serving.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in a T-bone steak?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”grilling is lower; frying or butter-basting adds 50-150 kcal.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a T-bone steak?
faqs.a: Around 60 g total fat, including 24 g saturated, for a 300g portion.

faqs.q: Are T-bone steaks high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, about 240 mg per 300g steak, mostly from the lean meat.
